question:
Eventually, technology will solve the most important environmental problems the world faces today.  

To what extent do you agree or disagree?
text: Many think that most of the significant issues of the environment nowadays can be solved by the technology. In my opinion, I believe that technology will not help, but rather, affect the surroundings negatively.

A good reason as to why technology will not be helpful in solving the important environmental problems is that it induces more air pollution. This is due to the fact that the technological devices that people use now have a more complex manufacturing process; mostly are harmful to the environment. For instance, the process of making cell phones involve burning and heating of certain materials, which emits unhealthy gas. This gas goes up to the ozone layer, makes it thinner, and thus creates more damaging effects to the earth's surface.

Another point to consider is that technology today is lowering the number of natural resources of the world, causing imbalances in nature. Most of the gadgets today are made out of metal and iron, collected from the deep core of the planet. Mining, for example, is one of the processes in which these minerals are collected and is causing soil erosion to some mainlands. This then causes catastrophes such as earthquakes and landslides, taking the lives of people and animals living in the area; a devastating effect that countries do not anticipate.

In conclusion, technology would not be able to solve the main environmental issues today as it may bring more negative effects such as poor air conditions and diminishing natural resources. Countries, therefore, should continue searching for available solutions to improve the environment's condition, especially for the future generations to come.
